comments.content: Is the answer correct Y/N/Y ? Please advise.

discussion.content: seems correct since User3 is a priority user for insider risk... tricky question

Th answer should be Yes/No/No. Alerts are only generated for DLP's that have a severity level of High. Anything lower doesn't generate an alert
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/insider-risk-management-policy-templates#data-leaks

Selected Answer: D
Outlook mobile on iOS and Android is not supported

choices.F: Outlook on the web, Outlook Win32, and Outlook for iOS and Android
choices.E: Outlook Win32 and Outlook for iOS and Android only
choices.C: Outlook for iOS and Android only
choices.D: Outlook on the web and Outlook Win32 only

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You create a data loss prevention (DLP) policy and select Use Notifications to inform your users and help educate them on the proper use of sensitive info.

Which apps will show the policy tip?

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.

You need to apply data loss prevention (DLP) policies to the following:

• Microsoft Exchange Online mailboxes
• Microsoft SharePoint Online sites
• Microsoft Power BI workspaces
• Microsoft OneDrive accounts
• On-premises repositories

What is the minimum number of DLP policies required to achieve the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct it's 2 not 4 you can select:
first Rule for: Exchange, OD4B, SPO, OnPrem
second rule: Fabric and PowerBi Workspaces
Tested in demo environment

Selected Answer: B
Believe the answer is 2. I can select Exchange, SharePoint, OneDrive and On-premises at the same time. Selecting PowerBI greys out all other options. Tested in lab

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.

After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.

You recently discovered that the developers at your company emailed Azure Storage keys in plain text to third parties.

You need to ensure that when Azure Storage keys are emailed, the emails are encrypted.

Solution: You create a data loss prevention (DLP) policy that has Exchange email, SharePoint sites, OneDrive accounts, and Teams chat and channel messages selected.

Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer is No. Once you select those other locations (Sharepoint Onedrive and Teams) The option to encrypt in the Rule action will be unavailable.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a Microsoft SharePoint Online site named Site1 and the data loss prevention (DLP) policies shown in the following table.

//IMG//


The DLP rules are configured as shown in the following table.

//IMG//


All the policies are assigned to Site1.

You need to ensure that if a user uploads a document to Site1 that matches all the rules, the user will be shown the Tip 2 policy tip.

What should you do?

choices.B: Prevent additional processing of the policies if there is a match for Rule2.
choices.C: Enable additional processing of the policies if there is a match for Rule1.
choices.A: Change the priority of DLP2 to 3.
choices.D: Change the priority of DLP2 to 0.
